verses.name: Proverbs 10:1
verses.text: The proverbs of Solomon. A wise son maketh a glad father: but a foolish son is the heaviness of his mother.

verses.name: Proverbs 10:2
verses.text: Treasures of wickedness profit nothing: but righteousness delivereth from death.

verses.name: Proverbs 10:3
verses.text: The Lord will not suffer the soul of the righteous to famish: but he casteth away the substance of the wicked.

verses.name: Proverbs 10:4
verses.text: He becometh poor that dealeth with a slack hand: but the hand of the diligent maketh rich.

verses.name: Proverbs 10:5
verses.text: He that gathereth in summer is a wise son: but he that sleepeth in harvest is a son that causeth shame.

verses.name: Proverbs 10:6
verses.text: Blessings are upon the head of the just: but violence covereth the mouth of the wicked.

verses.name: Proverbs 10:7
verses.text: The memory of the just is blessed: but the name of the wicked shall rot.

verses.name: Proverbs 10:8
verses.text: The wise in heart will receive commandments: but a prating fool shall fall.

verses.name: Proverbs 10:9
verses.text: He that walketh uprightly walketh surely: but he that perverteth his ways shall be known.

verses.name: Proverbs 10:10
verses.text: He that winketh with the eye causeth sorrow: but a prating fool shall fall.

verses.name: Proverbs 10:11
verses.text: The mouth of a righteous man is a well of life: but violence covereth the mouth of the wicked.

verses.name: Proverbs 10:12
verses.text: Hatred stirreth up strifes: but love covereth all sins.

verses.name: Proverbs 10:13
verses.text: In the lips of him that hath understanding wisdom is found: but a rod is for the back of him that is void of understanding.

verses.name: Proverbs 10:14
verses.text: Wise men lay up knowledge: but the mouth of the foolish is near destruction.

verses.name: Proverbs 10:15
verses.text: The rich man’s wealth is his strong city: the destruction of the poor is their poverty.

verses.name: Proverbs 10:16
verses.text: The labour of the righteous tendeth to life: the fruit of the wicked to sin.

verses.name: Proverbs 10:17
verses.text: He is in the way of life that keepeth instruction: but he that refuseth reproof erreth.

verses.name: Proverbs 10:18
verses.text: He that hideth hatred with lying lips, and he that uttereth a slander, is a fool.

verses.name: Proverbs 10:19
verses.text: In the multitude of words there wanteth not sin: but he that refraineth his lips is wise.

verses.name: Proverbs 10:20
verses.text: The tongue of the just is as choice silver: the heart of the wicked is little worth.

verses.name: Proverbs 10:21
verses.text: The lips of the righteous feed many: but fools die for want of wisdom.

verses.name: Proverbs 10:22
verses.text: The blessing of the Lord, it maketh rich, and he addeth no sorrow with it.

verses.name: Proverbs 10:23
verses.text: It is as sport to a fool to do mischief: but a man of understanding hath wisdom.

verses.name: Proverbs 10:24
verses.text: The fear of the wicked, it shall come upon him: but the desire of the righteous shall be granted.

verses.name: Proverbs 10:25
verses.text: As the whirlwind passeth, so is the wicked no more: but the righteous is an everlasting foundation.

verses.name: Proverbs 10:26
verses.text: As vinegar to the teeth, and as smoke to the eyes, so is the sluggard to them that send him.

verses.name: Proverbs 10:27
verses.text: The fear of the Lord prolongeth days: but the years of the wicked shall be shortened.

verses.name: Proverbs 10:28
verses.text: The hope of the righteous shall be gladness: but the expectation of the wicked shall perish.

verses.name: Proverbs 10:29
verses.text: The way of the Lord is strength to the upright: but destruction shall be to the workers of iniquity.

verses.name: Proverbs 10:30
verses.text: The righteous shall never be removed: but the wicked shall not inhabit the earth.

verses.name: Proverbs 10:31
verses.text: The mouth of the just bringeth forth wisdom: but the froward tongue shall be cut out.

verses.name: Proverbs 10:32
verses.text: The lips of the righteous know what is acceptable: but the mouth of the wicked speaketh frowardness.
